members.name: PositionSensorVRDevice.getState()
members.description: Returns the current state of the position sensor for the current frame (e.g. within the current window.requestAnimationFrame callback) or for the previous frame, contained with a VRPositionState object. This is the method you'd normally want to use, versus getImmediateState().

members.name: PositionSensorVRDevice.getImmediateState()
members.description: Returns the current instantaneous position sensor state. This is intended to only be used rarely, for certain special uses, for example sampling the immediate position of a hand orientation sensor — or at least it will be, in the future.

members.name: PositionSensorVRDevice.resetSensor()
members.description: Can be used to reset the sensor if desired, returning the position and orientation values to zero.

members.name: VRDevice.hardwareUnitId
members.description: Returns the distinct hardware ID for the overall hardware unit that this VRDevice is a part of. All devices that are part of the same physical piece of hardware will have the same hardwareUnitId.

members.name: VRDevice.deviceId
members.description: Returns the ID for this specific VRDevice. The ID shouldn’t change across browser restarts, allowing configuration data to be saved based on it.

members.name: VRDevice.deviceName
members.description: A human-readable name to identify the VRDevice.
